meanings.definition: To set or keep apart; divide or disunite
meanings.sent1: She is separating the different colored blocks into groups.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is separating the students into teams for the game.
meanings.sent3: The magician is separating the red scarves from the blue ones.
meanings.sent4: The river seems to be separating the two towns with its strong current.
meanings.sent5: The fence is separating the backyard from the front yard clearly.

meanings.definition: To part or divide a group or collection
meanings.sent1: He is separating the puzzle pieces to start putting them together.
meanings.sent2: The chef is separating the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent3: The siblings are playfully separating the candies into their favorite flavors.
meanings.sent4: The music is separating the crowd as some dance and others watch.
meanings.sent5: The organizer is separating the books by genre on the shelves.

meanings.definition: To discontinue a relationship or association
meanings.sent1: They are separating their business partnership due to creative differences.
meanings.sent2: The friends are separating after realizing they have grown apart.
meanings.sent3: The team is separating for the off-season but will reunite for training.
meanings.sent4: The actor is separating from the role he played for years to explore new characters.
meanings.sent5: The company is separating from its old image to attract a younger audience.
